            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The Prince Edward Island Department of Environment, Water and Climate Change conducts monitoring under several surface water monitoring programs in order to report on water quality to the public of Prince Edward Island. Sampling is carried out across the province and represents a range of land use. Results from both long-term and short-term sampling programs are included. Water quality data is collected by grab samples, submitted to the Standards Council of Canada accredited PEI Analytical Laboratories, and/or by calibrated multi-parameter meters. Some of this data is collected as part of the Canada-PEI Water Agreement. This data may also be accessed at its original source https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/en/service/view-surface-water-quality</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-g5s5-yj38
notes: The Prince Edward Island Department of Environment, Water and Climate Change conducts monitoring under several surface water monitoring programs in order to report on water quality to the public of Prince Edward Island. Sampling is carried out across the province and represents a range of land use. Results from both long-term and short-term sampling programs are included. Water quality data is collected by grab samples, submitted to the Standards Council of Canada accredited PEI Analytical Laboratories, and/or by calibrated multi-parameter meters. Some of this data is collected as part of the Canada-PEI Water Agreement. This data may also be accessed at its original source https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/en/service/view-surface-water-quality

notes_translated.en: The Prince Edward Island Department of Environment, Water and Climate Change conducts monitoring under several surface water monitoring programs in order to report on water quality to the public of Prince Edward Island. Sampling is carried out across the province and represents a range of land use. Results from both long-term and short-term sampling programs are included. Water quality data is collected by grab samples, submitted to the Standards Council of Canada accredited PEI Analytical Laboratories, and/or by calibrated multi-parameter meters. Some of this data is collected as part of the Canada-PEI Water Agreement. This data may also be accessed at its original source https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/en/service/view-surface-water-quality
notes_translated.fr: Le ministère de l'Environnement, de l'Eau et du Changement climatique de l'Île-du-Prince-Édouard effectue une surveillance dans le cadre de plusieurs programmes de surveillance des eaux de surface afin de rendre compte de la qualité de l'eau au public de l'Île-du-Prince-Édouard. L'échantillonnage est effectué dans toute la province et représente une gamme d'utilisations des terres. Les résultats des programmes d'échantillonnage à court et à long terme sont inclus. Les données sur la qualité de l'eau sont recueillies au moyen d'échantillons choisis, soumis aux laboratoires d'analyse de l'Île-du-Prince-Édouard accrédités par le Conseil canadien des normes, et/ou par des compteurs multiparamètres étalonnés. Certaines de ces données sont recueillies dans le cadre de l'Accord sur l'eau entre le Canada et l'Île-du-Prince-Édouard. Ces données sont également accessibles à leur source d'origine https://www.princeedwardisland.ca/en/service/view-surface-water-quality

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: Province of Prince Edward Island - Surface Water Quality Monitoring
